resources.string: The controller can function similarly to a laser pointer.\n\nPoint to the screen and shoot down the cluster of spiders.
The controller API can detect a whole range of device orientations, not just portrait and landscape.\n\nTry this simple \"match the orientation\" game for a demonstration.
The controller API is used to apply your device\'s rotation to a 3d model.\n\nHowever you rotate your device, that\'s how the model will rotate!
Position yourself in front of the TV
Hold your phone with its screen facing up (like a remote)
Hold your phone with its screen facing you (parallel to the TV)
Point your phone to the center of the TV screen
Hold your phone as shown to score a point
Click anywhere on your phone screen to shoot
Choose an experiment on you phone
Follow the instructions on your phone
Move your device around to manipulate the chair

This Android Experiment turns your phone into a 3D controller. It detects the device's orientation in 3D space (where it's pointing and how it's rotated) and makes that information accessible through a simple API. 

This app shows 3 demos that use the controller API.


The controller API and this app were made specifically for the Android Experiments 2016 Challenge. 

Developed by Hatem Shahbari & Yury Sachnovskiy
